summary.para: A pixel-shader interface manages an executable program (a pixel shader) that controls the pixel-shader stage.

remarks.para: The pixel-shader interface has no methods; use HLSL to implement your shader functionality. All shaders in Direct3D 10 are implemented from a common set of features referred to as the common shader core.
To create a pixel shader interface, call . Before using a pixel shader you must bind it to the device by calling .
This interface is defined in D3D10.h.
